ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about contemporary sculpture and techniques for creating sculptures.
How to sculpt things and how to think deeply about what is art and what makes art and how to form ideas into a visual display.
A better understanding of how sculptors see the world

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Even though this class was conducted over Zoom, we were mailed the a set of tools and building materials to allow us the experience of building our sculptures. Another huge plus is in the "crits" where the students discuss each others art.

This class was super fun and engaging. I would have liked to do one more project. I loved the crits and artist presentations--nice way to break up the class. Maybe some in-class on-screen sculpting together would have been cool.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely, especially for people wanting to get in touch with their creative side.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student because it was challenging in a fun and creative way. The class environment was really positive and encouraging and it was really awesome learning to work with new materials.
